actions.committee: House Committee on Standards of Official Conduct
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Standards of Official Conduct.
Reported to House from the Committee on Standards of Official Conduct with amendment, H. Rept. 94-76.
Measure called up by special rule in House.
Measure passed House, amended, roll call #121 (360-37).

official_title: Resolution to amend the Code of Official Conduct of the Rules of the House of Representatives.

summary.text: (Reported to House from the Committee on Standards of Official Conduct with amendment, H. Rept. 94-76) Requires a Member of the House of Representatives who has been convicted by a court of record for the commission of a crime for which a sentence of two or more years' imprisonment may be imposed to refrain from participation in the business of each committee of which he is a member and to refrain from voting on any question at a meeting of the House, or of the Committee of the Whole House, unless or until judicial or executive proceedings result in reinstatement of the presumption of his innocence or until he is reelected to the House after the date of such conviction.

titles.title: Resolution to amend the Code of Official Conduct of the Rules of the House of Representatives.
